model

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.GameState

  • public class GameState
extends java.util.Observable
    Contains the game state for the current game. Holds lists of all of the towers, enemies, projectiles, and can update them at every tick.
    Author:
    Ethan Glasberg (glasberg@email.arizona.edu), Jarod Bristol (jarodkylebristol@email.arizona.edu), Alex Gonzalez (aegonzalez793@email.arizona.edu), Patrick Dearborn (pdearborn@email.arizona.edu)

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Updates all of the enemies, towers, and projectiles currently active in the game (in that order). For each enemy in the game, we first check to see if it has passed over its current node in the path and if it has, increment the node. We then updte the enemies' positions by calling their respective update method. For each tower in the game, we iterate through all of the enemies to find the first one in its radius, and if it can generate a projectile we generate a projectile and point it in the direction of the enemy. For each projectile in the game, we call its respective update method to update its position on the board.

      • addTower

        public void addTower(Tower tower)
        Adds a tower to the list of towers currently in the game and notifies observers of this observable.
        Parameters:
        tower - the Tower to add to the game
